div.l: With grete othus he was so sworn adoıı̄un
That he was holden wood in al the toıı̄unn
For euery clerc anon held with othur
They seide the man was wood my lyue brothur
And euery man gan lawȝe at his striff
Thus swyued was the Carpenters wiff
For all his kepynge and hys Ielosye
And absoloıı̄un hath kyst hir nether ye
And nicholas is scalded in his toute
This tale is do and god saue alle þe route
Whanne men had laugh at this nise cas
Of absolon and of hende nycholas
Diuers men dyuers they seide
But for the more part þey lough and pleyd
Ne att this tale y saw noman him greue
But it were osewold only the Reue
Be cause he was of carpenters craft
A litil Ire is in his herte laft
He gan to grocche and blame it alite
So the ik ꝙquod he full well coude I yow quite
With blerynge of a proud millers ye
Yef that me liste to speke of Rebaudye
But ik am old and list not for to rage
Gras tyme is don̄ my fodir is for age
This white topp writith myn olde ȝers
Myn hete is mouled as myn hers
But yef y fare as doth an open ers
That ilke frut is euer the lenger þe wers
Til it be roten in mullok or in stre
We olde men y drede so fare we
Til we ben roten can we nouȝt ben rype
We hoppen alwey while þe world wil pype
For In our͗e wille the stikkyth euer anayll
To haue an an hoore heer and a grene tayle
As hath a leek for þow our͗e myȝt begon̄
Oure wille desirith folye euer in on
For whanne we may not don̄ than wille wewwe speke
Ȝit in our͗e asshen old fire is reke
